intro: Scolymus grandiflorus, commonly known as the giant scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, branching stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has rough, hairy leaves that are often lobed or toothed, and it produces elongated, cylindrical fruits that contain numerous seeds. Scolymus grandiflorus is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in its native habitat.
